platform.name: android
platform.info: You need to: * add "implements DatabaseInitializable" on your main class * implement the getDatabaseConfig method (with the correct database configuration) * implement the loadWebApp method (with the Cordova init code usually in the onCreate method) * remove the Cordova init code in the onCreate method * load the database and run the app with "DatabaseInitializer.load(this);" in the onCreate method * add the "Databases.db" file in your assets directory * add the zipped database to initialize in your assets directory

platform.name: ios
platform.info:
You need to:
* import "LoadDatabase.h" and "DatabaseConfig.h" in your main class * in the init method of your main class, call the "load" method on a "LoadDatabase" object with the correct DatabaseConfig in parameters: [[LoadDatabase new] load:[[DatabaseConfig alloc] init:@"myDemoSQLiteDB.zip" secondValue:@"myDemoSQLiteDB.db"]]; * add the "Databases.db" file in your Resources directory * add the zipped database to initialize in your Resources directory

platform.name: wp7
platform.info:
You need to:
* import "org.smile.websqldatabase" in your main class * in the init method of your main class, call the "LoadDatabase" method on a "DatabaseLoader" object with the correct DatabaseConfig in parameters: new DatabaseLoader().LoadDatabase(new DatabaseConfig(@"myDemoSQLiteDB.zip", @"myDemoSQLiteDB.db")); * add the zipped database to initialize in the root directory of your solution
